1.text: Wherefore, holy brethren, partakers of the heavenly calling, observe the sent and Chief Priest of our assent, Christ Jesus;

2.text: Faithful to him having made him, as also Moses in his whole house.

3.text: For this was deemed worthy of more glory than Moses, inasmuch as he has greater honour of the house having built it.

4.text: For every house is built by somebody; and he having built all things, God.

5.text: And truly Moses faithful in his whole house, as a servant, for a testimony of those things to be spoken;

6.text: And Christ as a son over his house: whose house are we, if we should hold freedom of speech and the boast of hope firm to the end.

7.text: Wherefore (as the Holy Spirit says, If to day ye hear his voice,

8.text: Harden not your hearts, as in the exasperation, in the day of trial in the desert:

9.text: Where your fathers tried me, proved me, and saw my works forty years.

10.text: Wherefore I was offended with that generation and I said, They always wander in heart; and they knew not my ways.

11.text: As I aware in my wrath, If they shall come into my rest.)

12.text: See, brethren, lest there shall be in any of you an evil heart of unbelief, in removing away from the living God.

13.text: But beseech one another according to each day, as far as the day is called; lest any of you be hardened by deceit of sin.

14.text: For we have been partakers of Christ, if we hold the beginning of our foundation firm to the end;

15.text: In that it is said, To day if ye will hear his voice, ye should not harden your hearts, as in the exasperation.

16.text: For some, having heard, did exasperate: but not all they having come out of Egypt by Moses.

17.text: And with whom was he offended forty years? was it not with them having sinned, whose members fell in the desert?

18.text: And to whom sware he that they could not come into his rest, if not to them having been disobedient?

19.text: And we see they could not come in through unbelief.
